abstract: Op-Ed article by policy expert Ross Perlin opposes Appeals Court decision that has upended how courts determine legality of an internship, saying court has struck yet another blow against exploited class of workers; argues ruling will make it all but impossible for interns to undertake collective action through class-action lawsuits, tactic that had shown great promise in improving conditions.
lead_paragraph: A federal court ruling makes it harder for students to challenge exploitative work programs.
snippet: A federal court ruling makes it harder for students to challenge exploitative work programs.
